reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa Steno is perfection in the Cinque Terre. The hotel is located in the old town of Moterosso on a hill with stunning views. Take a taxi from the train station. You don't want to lug your luggage up their steep driveway. The hotel is very clean with spectacular views from each room. Mateo and his wife, as well as Vanessa, could not have been sweeter or more helpful. They were the most gracious hosts. Wonderful people!! The location was perfect with great cafes just a minute or two walk down from the hotel. I would stay there again and again! Free Internet in the lobby with two computers at your disposal. Villa Steno is #1 on trip advisor in Monterosso for a reason.
reviews.title: Wonderful family-run hotel in Cinque Terre

reviews.text: Matteo and Carla run a exceptional hotel. You could eat off the floor of this beautiful place. We took two rooms with teenage kids. The location of the hotel, was in town, with an out -of -town feel. The rooms were nicely done, with A/C, mini fridge, safe and flat screen tv. Also, a fabulous terrace that overlooked the sea...Super clean and super nice! I will definetly be back again next year!
reviews.title: emaculate, wonderful hotel with a killer breakfast!
Wonderful hotel in a "Great Location"
reviews.text: The hotel has it all . Welcoming staff, great rooms with lovely views of the ocean and village, exceptionally clean with a very relaxing and tranquil atmosphere. Special thanks to Martina for her generous hospitality. Would definitely recommend.

I have just returned from my sixth stay at the Hotel Villa Steno and, per usual, it was a wonderful experience. I have been there with my three adult children, a best friend, with just my youngest daughter and this year by myself. Every time has been the same... the warm hospitality and inviting nature of Carla and Matteo, the owners, immediately makes you feel that you are welcome to their home, not "just a hotel." Every room has been perfect for the number of people who occupied it. The air conditioning has always been most welcome on some of the very warm and humid days but as the evening comes on and the temperature cools, it is so very pleasant to sit outside on a balcony, take in the gorgeous views and hear music at times from "downtown." Everything is sparkling clean and the staff very friendly and warm. Any information needed about the area...trails, a good restaurant, train and boat schedules, even where to buy lettuce.. are easily handled by the staff and you are provided with a wonderful packet about the hotel and surrounding areas when you check in. Breakfast is fabulous with a HUGE spread of breads, sweets, meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereals, homemade marmalades, juices, and any coffee drink you could possibly want. As I always drive to Monterosso it is wonderful to have parking during my stay as finding parking in or near this town is nearly impossible. This year I extended my visit a little bit and per usual, even this wasn't long enough. I will just have to add another day or two to my next visit!!
reviews.title: A "must return to" hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Villa Steno but our stay of only 2 nights was too short - would love to return one day. The location on the hill was great with superb views over the town and to the sea from our balcony. Matteo and Carla were most friendly and obliging, together with the staff who were pleasant, helpfull and smiling. The air conditioned room was comfortable and clean with the view from the balcony a highlight - breafast on the hotel terrace with the same view was a real treat. We woul recommend this hotel to anyone
reviews.title: Enjoyable Hotel with Wonderful Views

reviews.text: Hotel Villa Steno has everything you could ever want to make your stay in the Cinque Terre very special!.Matteo and Carla run a beautiful hotel with the highest of standards.This was our third visit to Villa Steno and once again we were so warmly welcomed.All the staff are most helpful and couldn't be more helpful with dinner reservations,travel enquiries etc.The views from the breakfast balcony are spectacular.Breakfast is excellent!The hotel is sparkling clean.Bedrooms are well air conditioned,well designed with lovely balconies!Villa Steno is in the old town and just a short stroll to the beach and all the lovely restaurants,wine bars...The train and the ferry are just a few minutes walk as well.It's worth getting a taxi if you have luggage,as the hotel is on a height,but location is excellent,within walking distance to all the lovely amenities.We stayed a week and look forward to returning again and again!Thanks to Carla,Matteo ,Martine and Roberta!
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel to return to again and again!

reviews.text: Villa Steno was everything other reviews had promised. Amazing views with lovely private balcony, as well as public space. Easy walk though town to the beach. Even in the height of tourist season we never felt crowded. The breakfast service was lovely , giving us a great start to our days of hiking and swimming. My only precaution would be for anyone not able to handle steep stairs, but that goes for most of Cinque Terre.
reviews.title: Fabulous View, great staff, wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a warm welcome from the owner. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable with good airconditioning. Owner's recommendations on where to eat and what to see were perfect. Sightseeing was a mixture of ferry, walking and train, all within a few minutes walk from the hotel. Breakfast on the terrace was delightful. Free internet was very useful with owner going out of his way to download needed software. Parking is tricky with a cliff on one side and steep fall on the other - best left to the experience of the owner to turn your car around.
reviews.title: Welcoming and comfortable hotel in good location

reviews.text: We stayed at the villa steno for 5 nights. At first I was concerned that there would be enough for our family to do in monterosso but that definitely was not the case.
reviews.title: Italian lifestyle at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a little trek up the hill to the hotel especially with four bags and two young boys that gave up half way but when we finally reached the reception we instantly forgot the hot steep climb. To be honest by European standards it is not bad at all and the view of Monterosso is well worth it. Once checked in there is an easier pathway to access through the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Hotel Steno and again we enjoyed the great hospitality of Matteo and Carla and their staff. We arrived from Milan by train which is very easy. We had a seaview room with courtyard filled with lemon trees overlooking the town...magnificent!! Breakfast is a real pleasure on the balcony...great food ..unbelievable views. Free Wi Fi is a great bonus. The hotel is central to the town and its many restaurants. Hotel Steno is a beautiful clean hotel and we will defintely be returning.
reviews.title: "Magical"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Connie
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit worried about this hotel as the pictures looked like it might be quite dated. But it was not. The hallways and common areas are tiled in what North Americans might see as a dated look but once you get there it works just fine. I like my hotels modern and clean and this one was great for me. Everything is CLEAN! I was so impressed with the way this family keeps this hotel especially as I did not have this same experience in some other hotels. We had a balcony (I'd recommend spending the extra to enjoy that lovely view). We had a major thunder storm while we were there and were able to sit and enjoy it from our room. The bathrooms are small but very modern and very clean.
reviews.title: A truly pleasurable stay at Villa Steno!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was wonderful (traditional European buffet) and they also provided a sandwich and drink service if requested so on that rainy day we did not have to go out at all. The cleaning staff was very friendly and every day the rooms were cleaned and mopped more thoroughly than most hotels would do between guests. They also provided a laundry service which was very needed by us at that time. Although it was a bit costly sometimes it is worthwhile after weeks of washing clothes by hand.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Owned Hotel

reviews.text: The stairs - there were 121 stairs from the grocery store in town (which is right where the stairs come out) to our room. However, the stairs are broken up so that you can take a bit of a break in the lemon grove. I'm not very fit and still managed the stairs fine in the heat of the day. Granted you probably would not want to be a very forgetful person and go up and down them several times before heading out for the day. There are no elevators. We originally picked the hotel because it was close to the parking lot for the town but then we switched to arriving by train. You can walk from the train station to the hotel but if you have lots of bags or feel tired take a cab - they can get you right to the door. Also, do not take luggage up the outside stairs (unless you want to test your fitness level!) - instead walk past the stairs, past the grocery store and head up the street to towards the town parking lot - just before you get there, there is a driveway to your left which you can roll up (you go under an apartment building) and then end up at the front door of the hotel without having taken any stairs (this works well for luggage on wheels) - it is still a steep hill though.
reviews.title: Nice view overlooking the town

reviews.text: We unfortunately only had one night to spend here on our way from France to Florence but would love to go back. Staff was very helpful with our late arrival and departure and the room was very nice but if you are a big guy the tiny bathroom and shower could be a challenge. Beautiful view from a private balcony.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 lovely days at this expertly run little hotel overlooking the rooftops and the sea in Montorosso. Breakfast was wonderful and the room was efficiently designed and supurbly comfortable. We travel all over the world---and this is as close to perfection as a iittle 3* gets!
reviews.title: As close to perfection as a small 3* hotel gets!

reviews.text: We arrived after a 15 day european trip to be greeted by a friendly and most helpful lady. Carla was just so helpful, it was early in the morning so our room wasnt ready we didnt expect it to be but Carla took our bags and showed us around anyway. she made sure we saw our room and were happy. We were most impressed! we had a two bedroom room with an amazing view and spacious outdoor terrace.
reviews.title: An amazing place with incredible hospitality!

reviews.text: A really wonderful place, very clean, very helpful and hospitable staff! would definitley return and recommed to others!
reviews.title: Feel like you are part of the family!

reviews.text: Friendly and clean family run hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very close to the restaurants and the main walking streets. The amenities are very new and clean. Loved the selection of books you can borrow.
reviews.title: Felt like you'd just come home!
